abstract: Anglo Irish Bank, the lender whose huge bets on development in Ireland now epitomize the reckless excess of its real estate bubble, said late Tuesday that it had lost another 17.6 billion euros last year.
snippet: Anglo Irish Bank, the lender whose huge bets on development in Ireland now epitomize the reckless excess of its real estate bubble, said late Tuesday that it had lost another 17.6 billion euros last year.
lead_paragraph: Anglo Irish Bank, the lender whose huge bets on development have come to epitomize the reckless excess of Ireland’s real estate bubble, said late on Tuesday that it lost 17.6 billion euros in 2010.

headline.main: Anglo Irish Lost 17.6 Billion Euros in 2010

abstract: The Bundesbank said there would be no “imminent” announcement regarding Axel Weber, who is seen as the front-runner to become head of the European Central Bank this year.
snippet: The Bundesbank said there would be no “imminent” announcement regarding Axel Weber, who is seen as the front-runner to become head of the European Central Bank this year.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT Axel Weber, president of the Bundesbank, may remove himself as a candidate to become president of the European Central Bank, potentially opening up the race for what is arguably the Continent’s most important public post, according to German media and wire reports on Wednesday.

headline.main: European Central Bank Candidate Said to Be Wavering
headline.print_headline: European Central Bank Candidate Said to Be Wavering

abstract: The banking industry may have to spend $60 billion to buy back troubled mortgages, according to a report from Standard & Poor’s.
snippet: The banking industry may have to spend $60 billion to buy back troubled mortgages, according to a report from Standard & Poor’s.
lead_paragraph: The banking industry may have to spend more than $60 billion to buy back troubled mortgages, according to a report released on Tuesday by Standard & Poor’s.

headline.main: Banks Could Face $60 Billion Tab on Bad Mortgage Loans

abstract: No Bank of America Bombshell?|The Next Wave in Exchange Mergers| Daniel Loeb Puts Down His Pen
snippet: No Bank of America Bombshell?|The Next Wave in Exchange Mergers| Daniel Loeb Puts Down His Pen
lead_paragraph: A Weak WikiLeak? Remember all the noise about the Bank of America data dump being prepared by Wikileaks? Reuters reports that Julian Assange has told people that the material is dated and that “he personally was unable to make much sense of it.” Reuters
